remarks: This lemma proves that for ` n ` sufficiently large, q_n( t ) > ( 1 - epsilon ), for all ` t ` in ` V ` : see Lemma 1 [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 90, (at the bottom of page 90). ` Q ` is used to represent q_n in the paper, ` N ` to represent ` n ` in the paper, ` K ` to represent ` k ` , ` D ` to represent δ, and ` E ` to represent ε.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
stoweidlem24.1 $e |- V = { t e. T | ( P ` t ) < ( D / 2 ) } $.
stoweidlem24.2 $e |- Q = ( t e. T |-> ( ( 1 - ( ( P ` t ) ^ N ) ) ^ ( K ^ N ) ) ) $.
stoweidlem24.3 $e |- ( ph -> P : T --> RR ) $.
stoweidlem24.4 $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN0 ) $.
stoweidlem24.5 $e |- ( ph -> K e. NN0 ) $.
stoweidlem24.6 $e |- ( ph -> D e. RR+ ) $.
stoweidlem24.8 $e |- ( ph -> E e. RR+ ) $.
stoweidlem24.9 $e |- ( ph -> ( 1 - E ) < ( 1 - ( ( ( K x. D ) / 2 ) ^ N ) ) ) $.
stoweidlem24.10 $e |- ( ph -> A. t e. T ( 0 <_ ( P ` t ) /\ ( P ` t ) <_ 1 ) ) $.
stoweidlem24 $p |- ( ( ph /\ t e. V ) -> ( 1 - E ) < ( Q ` t ) ) $.
